title.narrative: PMTCT PROGRAMMES

description.narrative: Selected MDAs, LGAs and NSAs implement evidence-based Prevention of Mother to Child Transmission of HIV (PMTCT) (HIV prevention) programmes, which contributes to Health â€“ General, Hiv Prevention, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Protect, Care And Support Children And Families Affected By Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved and equitable use of high impact Maternal, Neonatal, and Child Health (MNCH) and nutrition interventions and promotion of healthy behaviours and nutrition practices

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Selected MDAs, LGAs and NSAs implement evidence-based PMTCT (HIV prevention) programmes

description.narrative: Prevention of Mother to Child Transmission (PMTCT) of HIV expanded with 90% of pregnant women tested receiving anti retro viral treatment to protect their babies and improve their health. | Status:Met | As-of Date:27/07/2016
